title: Mesquite MoCap — Open-Source Wearable 6-DoF Motion Capture
blurb: Real-time full-body mocap using 15 wireless IMU nodes; engineered for low cost and real-world constraints.
details: Built/debugged firmware + networking, tuned fusion and streaming; validated against OptiTrack and supported reproducible workflows.

title: To Wilt — MFA Thesis (4-Space Installation)
blurb: A research-driven installation studying how LLMs express (or simulate) love and emotion via long-form dialogue—connected to physical media and sensing.
details: Multi-screen video wall, live web dialogue, dot-matrix printouts, and time-lapse decay dataset integrated with environmental telemetry.

title: Opuntia — Solar-Powered Sensor-Fusion Environmental Station
blurb: Off-grid station with duty cycling + timestamp integrity, built for outages and recovery/backfill.
details: Integrated multi-sensor telemetry and database-backed logging for daily histories and microclimate measurement.

title: Temporal Fusion Transformers for S&P 500 Forecasting
blurb: Co-led forecasting work with TFT variants and LSTM baselines, focusing on mixed-frequency pipelines.
details: Designed preprocessing/alignment and ran controlled ablations under deadline constraints.

title: Happenstance — Image-to-Avatar Pipeline for Virtual Worlds
blurb: Turning a single photograph into a rigged 3D character for rapid import into virtual environments.
details: Iterating toward a faster, repeatable end-to-end workflow for avatar creation.

title: Multi-Phone 3D Capture Rig (In progress)
blurb: Low-cost synchronized multi-phone rig for small-scale multi-view capture.
details: Designed for flexible XR/HRI experiments with reproducible calibration + sync pipelines.

title: Deep Learning Foundations — Reproducible HPC Assignments (A1–A4)
blurb: A sequence of DL builds: classifiers, ViT fine-tuning, perceptual loss, custom ResNet/activation, SIREN, GANs/diffusion.
details: Emphasis on reproducibility: dataset splits, ablations, visualization, and HPC job workflows.
